wikipedia_page.main: John Eddowes Bowman the Elder (30 October 1785 – 4 December 1841) was a British banker and naturalist.

response: *John Eddowes Bowman the Elder (1785–1841), British banker and naturalist

Henry Bowman was born in Nantwich, Cheshire, in 1814, the second son of John Eddowes Bowman the Elder.*Hall J. A History of the Town and Parish of Nantwich, or Wich Malbank, in the County Palatine of Chester, pp. 508–10 (2nd edn) (E. J. Morten; 1972) () Bowman worked as an architect in Manchester, from 1840 to about 1883, in partnership with Joseph Stretch Crowther. He designed Congleton Workhouse in 1838 and Stockport Union Workhouse in 1840.
* John Eddowes Bowman the Elder (1785–1841), British botanist and mycologist with the standard author abbreviation 'Bowman'
* John Eddowes Bowman the Younger (1819–1854), English chemist, son of John Eddowes Bowman the Elder
